intro: Uvifera ilheensis, commonly known as the Ilheus grapevine, is a unique species native to the island of Ilheus in Brazil. It is a climbing plant belonging to the Vitaceae family, characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red or black upon maturity. Its botanical features make it an important species for local biodiversity and ecological studies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered plant.
